titleStmt.title: P5 today: current state of play

publicationStmt.p: Currently unpublished for TEI Council and editors' use.

body.p: This is a working document for the use of the TEI Council and Editors. It summarizes briefly the current state of play and intended future work with respect to each chapter of P5. For more detailed information, consult the working directory currently maintained in the CVS Repository at tei.sf.net; for strategic information about the overall goals of the P5 revision, and the version of it currently visible to the public, see .
This document lists the chapters of P5, with an indication of the current status of each

Under the heading prognosis, we give our current assessment of the amount of work needed on each chapter, defined in the following broad terms:
stet
No action needed major surgery
Complete rewrite needed minor surgery
Basically sound, but new material needs to be added convalescent
New material has been approved by Council and incorporated but editorial work is incomplete for checking
No major changes anticipated but not yet checked for P5 consistency for deletion
Proposed for removal at P5 discharged
No further work is proposed on this chapter

All chapters and all validatable examples have been validated against the current P5 schemas. This validation procedure is now built in to the process of building a new release, so it should not need further attention.

div.head: Tasklist
div.p:
The following involve major work on a chapter. They are all urgent:
Expand discussion of customization features in TD using Lite as an example.
Revise MD, CF, and IN in light of new customization features. Document features for modification and i18n
Expand SG to include discussion of RelaxNG and other schemas [urgent]: mostly needs prose tidy-up, and some relaxng schema examples: needed for Fabio's book: [SB by 31 Jul]
Revise ST: in particular
overhaul discussion of class system
add new material about proposed new core modules
Review HD and update its metadata discussion: consolidate and move discussion of other metadata schemes in current HD and IH; review other schemes not so far discussed; create new material about compatibility and mapping, to include (possibly) discussion about using namespaces, using existing MD methods, using generic metadata tags (if so proposed by teilib)
Consider reorganization/modularization of Core
Expand discussion of <choice> mechanism
Add discussion of prosopographic issues to ND, moving it fron MS and CO: a draft proposal is needed
Revise DI
New version of TE
More examples for MS; act on suggestions on SF
Expand and clarify discussion of linking in SA and CO, particularly discussion of syntax for extended pointers xpaths
Add discussion of standoff annotation to NH (or SA?)

The following can be done at any time: for revised chapters, they will be done during revision; for others, they will be done during final sweep through (c. sept).
Check that none of the typos etc. lately fixed in P4 (as documented in ) has survived into P5 [passim]
Check and amend references to DTD language constructs [passim]
Check and amend references to P4 structural architecture (eg base/additional tagsets) [passim]
Revise base chapters to remove references to their status as bases

The following are either non-urgent or undecided:
Check conformity of CH language identification recs with eg Ethnolog practice [soon]
Consider what to do about remaining CDATA attributes [passim]
Merge CF and IN into new freestanding document on Conformance
Decide whether or not to split up FT; bring it up to date
Decide whether or not to split up CP; HD

The following cannot be done until everything else is finished:
Draft new preface to reflect current state of affairs. [final]
Rewrite AB to reflect current state of affairs. [final]
Either update or remove BIB
